TitleSelect: Digital World: "20 Bộ câu hỏi & Trả lời | Exploring the Digital World: The Importance of Computers in Modern Life"
ListenList: Are you computer literate?
Maria is computer literate and uses it daily.
John is somewhat literate but prefers using his phone.
Anna is highly computer literate and works in IT.
Are you connected to the Internet?
Maria has a stable internet connection.
John uses mobile data.
Anna has a high-speed internet connection at home.
Do you access the Internet with your computer?
Maria uses her computer to access the Internet for work and study.
John rarely uses his computer for the Internet, preferring his tablet.
Anna accesses the Internet with her computer for programming and research.
Can you access the Internet from your home?
Maria can access the Internet from every room.
John has limited access in some parts of his home.
Anna has strong Wi-Fi coverage throughout her house.
What is your favorite "news" site?
Maria likes to read BBC News online.
John prefers CNN for the latest updates.
Anna enjoys reading technology news on TechCrunch.
What Internet sites do you visit regularly?
Maria regularly visits educational websites.
John often visits sports and entertainment sites.
Anna frequently visits coding forums and tech blogs.
Can your mother and father use a computer?
Maria's parents can use a computer but need help sometimes.
John's parents are not very good with computers.
Anna's parents are quite proficient with computers.
Do you have a computer at work and at home?
Maria has a computer at both places.
John only has a computer at home.
Anna has multiple computers at both work and home.
Do you have a laptop or a desktop computer?
Maria has a laptop.
John uses a desktop computer.
Anna has both a laptop and a desktop computer.
Do you use your computer when you do homework for school?
Maria always uses her computer for homework.
John prefers to do his homework on paper.
Anna uses her computer for all school assignments.
Have you ever studied English using your computer?
Maria uses online courses to study English.
John has used apps to improve his English.
Anna took an online English class.
How many times have you upgraded your computer?
Maria upgraded her computer twice.
John has never upgraded his computer.
Anna upgrades her computer every year.
How powerful is your computer?
Maria's computer is quite powerful and can handle multiple tasks.
John’s computer is basic and sometimes slow.
Anna's computer is very powerful, suitable for programming and gaming.
What company made your computer?
Maria's computer is from Dell.
John’s computer is from HP.
Anna’s computer is custom-built.
What kind of computer do you have?
Maria has a Windows PC.
John has a Mac.
Anna has a Linux machine.
What size is your computer screen? What do you think is the best size to have?
Maria's screen is 15 inches and she thinks it’s perfect.
John has a 27-inch screen and prefers large displays.
Anna uses a 24-inch screen and thinks it’s the best size for her work.
Where do you use your computer?
Maria uses her computer in her bedroom.
John uses his computer in the living room.
Anna uses her computer in her home office.
Where in your room is your computer?
Maria's computer is on a desk by the window.
John's computer is on a table near the TV.
Anna's computer is on a dedicated workstation.
Why did you buy your computer?
Maria bought it for school and personal use.
John bought his for entertainment.
Anna bought hers for work and gaming.
Do you know any computer programming languages?
Maria knows a little bit of HTML.
John does not know any programming languages.
Anna knows several programming languages including Python and Java.

seo.Title: Exploring the Digital World: The Importance of Computers in Modern Life
seo.metaTitle: Digital World: "20 Bộ câu hỏi & Trả lời | Exploring the Digital World: The Importance of Computers in Modern Life"
seo.metaDescription: Understand the crucial role computers play in our daily lives. Learn about the benefits of computer literacy, internet access, and how computers enhance productivity and connectivity.

contentArray.content: Computers have become an integral part of modern life, influencing nearly every aspect of our daily routines, work, and leisure activities. Studying computers is essential for several reasons. Firstly, computer literacy is a critical skill in today’s digital age. Understanding how to use computers efficiently enables individuals to perform a wide range of tasks, from basic document creation to complex data analysis, enhancing productivity and effectiveness in various fields. Secondly, computers provide access to the internet, a vast resource of information and communication. With internet access, individuals can stay informed about current events, connect with others globally, and access educational resources, which is particularly important for remote learning and continuous education. Furthermore, the ability to navigate the internet safely and responsibly is crucial for protecting personal information and avoiding cyber threats. Thirdly, computers support creativity and innovation. They are powerful tools for designing, programming, and creating content, allowing users to bring their ideas to life. This is especially significant in fields such as graphic design, software development, and digital media, where computers serve as the primary medium for work. Additionally, computers play a vital role in various professional sectors, including healthcare, finance, education, and engineering. Knowledge of specific computer applications and programming languages can open up numerous career opportunities and enhance job prospects. Moreover, computers facilitate efficient data management and analysis. In business, this capability helps in making informed decisions, optimizing operations, and gaining insights through big data analytics. Lastly, understanding computers and technology is essential for participating in the global economy and staying competitive in the job market. As technology continues to evolve, keeping up with advancements and acquiring new digital skills are imperative for personal and professional growth. Overall, studying computers empowers individuals to harness the full potential of technology, improving their quality of life and contributing to societal progress.
